reviews.text:
Loads of planes and helicopters, all really cool. 

Interesting, informative, thought provoking. Focuses on the human side of war in the air as much as the technology. All the better for it.

Currently on display is a collection of art created by students at a local school. Some real talent there.

Cafe, gift shop, plenty of parking, excellent accessibility for less able folk. Easy to find and plenty of parking. Look for the plane by the Mobil petrol station.

Excellent place to visit building is beautifully done spent 3hrs. The tour was informative and fun. Cafe was clean with excellent food. Gift shop had good quality stuff. Will definitely go back when in Christchurch again best place I've been couldn't fault it right done to all the staff. My 16yr old son raved about it.

The museum has historic airplanes in a very good restored condition.
It has a lot of space to walk and sit around, it's very clean including its bathrooms.
The staff is very kind and friendly and they have free tours during the day and the access to the museum is free of charge. Very impressive. We were very glad to luckily have stopped by.

Visit the Air Force Museum it is worth it.  The military aircraft on display are impressive.  Full size aircraft such as a Dakota DC3 and a Spitfire.

The facilities can be hired and significantly sized functions can be held onsite. 

There is a cafeteria and restrooms as well as plenty of car parks usually always available.

The Air Force Museum is a definite go and see place if you haven't been there.

First class museum made sure this was top of my list of places to visit during my time in Christchurch. Not disappointed, be sure to take the tour, guides are great and you get to see behind the scenes, great little cafe and very friendly staff.

Modest museum within a peaceful oasis of calm. Only 4 stars because the building is old and a few poorly lit areas. Highly recommended though because the collection is both beautiful and compelling. English language descriptors and historical overviews are terrific. I spent nearly 3 hours in the collection and chilling with coffee in the charming open air courtyard cafe. Well worth the time to see high quality art and study history from a Vietnamese perspective.

Has a great collection of art work from few hundred years back until the modern times. Do get to know about Vietnam's struggle for independence before you enter any museum in Vietnam. There is a fine collection of Chinaware and recent art work in the adjoining building. Good place to spend some 2 hours of your day if you are interested in history and art.

Excellent art collections. Truely astonishing. These artistic pieces beautifully narrate Vietnam's history and bravery. Nice coffee shop within its territory. Staffs are friendly. Ticket price is very reasonable. Highly recommend to come.

Provides a brief history of Vietnam's art history, beautiful curations by local national artists. Go drop by if love historical art! Also beside another tourist attraction which is the temple, so you can visit more places 👌
Interesting and unusual for western visitors.  Takes you through the last 2000 years . Good outdoor cafe just outside.

Very hot inside...little or no A/c just  a few fans. Interesting historic items and a few hands on displays. I feel I needed more of a backstory on the famous women to better appreciate the items that were on display. The videos of village women struggling to make money in Hanoi was touching and made me understand better the local vendors. The gift shop was great.

Very good display. However, keep your expectations low. This is not a feminist place. Actually the first floor is about marriage (just a women thing?) and it heavily emphasizes the the old-fashioned role of the woman in the family—she has to stay at home taking care of children. Also there are pics of children working which is a weird thing to be proud of. You will learn a lot about marriage traditions though. The second floor is cool because the exhibit is about a dozen of female warriors. Again, do not expect to read a word about gender inequality or the like. The museum is largely pure propaganda. The signs have better info than the audio guide which is really poor.

Absolutely a first class museum and a must see attraction in Hanoi if you're new to the country or interested in learning about the role of women in recent history in particular.

Centrally located so pretty easy to find and it is a fairly modern building so we'll lit and laid out. Exhibition is on 3 floors at least so access maybe an issue. Sorry I can't remember if there is a lift.

The first floor we looked at was about traditional marriage rituals and customs some of which seemed similar to rural India in the past but there really is a huge amount of difference with modern life especially in the West. A lot of these traditions are recent or still practiced so there is plenty of photographic and even film evidence. There is also a lot of examples of traditional and tribal variation in clothing which I was least interested in.

For most people though the floor devoted to women at war is the main point of interest. As with the other war museums across Vietnam, there is a degree of propaganda to get past, but the breadth of roles women had is what really stands out. They were fighting on the front lines in the Vietnam War as well as holding communities together whilst living underground for months and sometimes years. Take your time to read the stories as many of them are shocking in their own right but also much of it will link to other war history sites you may want to visit. Going further back, there is some really good material on the female freedom fighters who fought French rule and those who rose to prominence in the Vietnamese Communist Party. 

The museum also acknowledges that it is women who largely keep the market stalls flourishing across the country and that a huge amount of the street food traders are women. What I hadn't realised is just how many are migrants, sleeping in shared housing or dorms and only seeing their husbands and children a few times a year if they are lucky. Well worth giving a few hours to exploring.

You learn about minority marriage process; the role women, men and children play in society; see minority clothing; and learn about the female heroines.  My favorite part was the short movie which interviewed street vendors.  Also, the shop and restaurant were nice and modern.  Really good prices in the shop if looking for souvenirs.

This is a beautiful museum that honors women from Vietnam's history. Each floor of this museum is broken up by different themes (family, marriage, clothing, war, etc, etc). As an American I took my time in the war section. It's truly amazing how many women were in positions of power within Vietnam's military at such young ages and accomplished many first time feats within it's military. 

This museum really shares what it means to be a woman and for that it gets a 5 star!

An incredibly informative museum. Go and learn about his life, not just the war with the U.S. but everything before as well. Don’t expect the history to be spoon fed to you. There is plenty to read in English. If you are really interested in knowing, prepare to take your time to browse the kiosks at every exhibit. The small entrance fee is well worth it. 

As a side note, food and refreshments, convenient (WC) restrooms, and places to rest are abundant in the vicinity.

An incredible museum, leading me to tears on a few occasions. This is a must visit. Be sure to ask for a guide, the employees are very knowledge, and can guide you through the museum's narrative. I will never forget my conversations with the museum's staff, and the horrific struggles of their countries people. The star of the show may well be Ho Chi Min, and for good reasons, but the level of injustice will become apparent after you have toured this building.

I actually like this museum very much. It is a very well stuctured museum and you can learn a lot from it. It is quite small and can take your time to see everything. They close the door 10 minutes before the closing time and will rush you to be out by the closing time. (They literally stand behind you and tell you to walk faster towards the exit)
Not a bad museum if you want to know about Ho Chi Minh in detail. Entry fee is 40k but what I liked was the air conditioning after I walked around the mausoleum and near by attractions.

The Mesuem is in the complex of the Presidential Palace and we walked to it after seeing the One pillar pagoda, also in the same vicinity. 
There were some souvenir shops selling trinkets, knick knack and fridge magnets. Some are selling shawls and t-shirts. 
I had a good walk here.

Phenomenal experience. 
Wonderful insight to the lives of the ethnic groups.
Lots of information, you could spend all day outside but there's also a lot of information and antiques inside the actual museum building.
Very affordable as well.
Great way to spend a sunny day in Hanoi

This museum contains a wealth of information on different ethnicities in Vietnam. It has a good restaurant and two gift shops. There are outside displays that are worth visiting. I highly recommend if you are in Hanoi to visit this museum.
Great place to discover more about Vietnamese culture and ethnic groups of Vietnam. Had a great guide who told us a lot of deep interesting information. Nice way to get to know Vietnam. 😎👍

There are both indoor and outdoor activities. The indoor includes the ethnic of Vietnam and some places around the world.  

The design of the new indoor building is interesting. 

The outside is fun and interesting too. The water puppet show is 30 min each session and give a flavor to foreigners about it. The show can be found here

Awesome collection of Vietnam  culture in Hanoi...It gives a peep into the life of people in Vietnam..
Beautiful collection of artifacts, everyday things well maintained and nicely displayed. Huts , old river mill all make this place a must visit...Spacious place nicely kept.
A nice souvenir shop completes the trip

Very big. It has two big building so check the opening hour. Closing hour and lunch time if you want to see it all. I do not recommend the audio guide because it is really sleepy.. But good exhibition. If i visit here again, then i think i need a guide to understand history of vietnam well.

Very beautiful building inside with lots of interesting exhibits... very well worth a visit... a small entrance fee is charged for the national museum and includes the revolution museum across the road...
The museum is good and informative but its quite hot, no aircon.....
An interesting museum, filled with artifacts from Vietnam's early history. I must profess that I preferred the sister museum across the road, but this one is still worth a visit.
Located in one of the best impressive French building in Hanoi. Giving details about Vietnamese history over 4 thousands years. Always like to visit it here

Very hot inside...little or no A/c just  a few fans. Interesting historic items and a few hands on displays. I feel I needed more of a backstory on the famous women to better appreciate the items that were on display. The videos of village women struggling to make money in Hanoi was touching and made me understand better the local vendors. The gift shop was great.

Very good display. However, keep your expectations low. This is not a feminist place. Actually the first floor is about marriage (just a women thing?) and it heavily emphasizes the the old-fashioned role of the woman in the family—she has to stay at home taking care of children. Also there are pics of children working which is a weird thing to be proud of. You will learn a lot about marriage traditions though. The second floor is cool because the exhibit is about a dozen of female warriors. Again, do not expect to read a word about gender inequality or the like. The museum is largely pure propaganda. The signs have better info than the audio guide which is really poor.

Absolutely a first class museum and a must see attraction in Hanoi if you're new to the country or interested in learning about the role of women in recent history in particular.

Centrally located so pretty easy to find and it is a fairly modern building so we'll lit and laid out. Exhibition is on 3 floors at least so access maybe an issue. Sorry I can't remember if there is a lift.

The first floor we looked at was about traditional marriage rituals and customs some of which seemed similar to rural India in the past but there really is a huge amount of difference with modern life especially in the West. A lot of these traditions are recent or still practiced so there is plenty of photographic and even film evidence. There is also a lot of examples of traditional and tribal variation in clothing which I was least interested in.

For most people though the floor devoted to women at war is the main point of interest. As with the other war museums across Vietnam, there is a degree of propaganda to get past, but the breadth of roles women had is what really stands out. They were fighting on the front lines in the Vietnam War as well as holding communities together whilst living underground for months and sometimes years. Take your time to read the stories as many of them are shocking in their own right but also much of it will link to other war history sites you may want to visit. Going further back, there is some really good material on the female freedom fighters who fought French rule and those who rose to prominence in the Vietnamese Communist Party. 

The museum also acknowledges that it is women who largely keep the market stalls flourishing across the country and that a huge amount of the street food traders are women. What I hadn't realised is just how many are migrants, sleeping in shared housing or dorms and only seeing their husbands and children a few times a year if they are lucky. Well worth giving a few hours to exploring.

You learn about minority marriage process; the role women, men and children play in society; see minority clothing; and learn about the female heroines.  My favorite part was the short movie which interviewed street vendors.  Also, the shop and restaurant were nice and modern.  Really good prices in the shop if looking for souvenirs.

This is a beautiful museum that honors women from Vietnam's history. Each floor of this museum is broken up by different themes (family, marriage, clothing, war, etc, etc). As an American I took my time in the war section. It's truly amazing how many women were in positions of power within Vietnam's military at such young ages and accomplished many first time feats within it's military. 

This museum really shares what it means to be a woman and for that it gets a 5 star!

This lake is again quite big in size bit I found it not maintained as the other lake. You can walk along the shore but there’s not much activity going on .you can skip to go and see this lake if you have limited time. Choose any other good attractions to see rather than going here.
Very nice and peaceful place. We can walk around, so stay at a coffee/tea shop, get a drink and enjoy the view. Very like this lake.

Visited the lake in march, spring season. It was very cold (~19C). The air here is fresher than old quarters as there are lesser vehicles and scooters. There are many cafes that offer affordable cocounuts for you to drink while relaxing and enjoying the view and breeze. The place is quite far from old quarters by foot, highly recommended to take the taxi.

Three times a week. In afternoon, i take my dog to go around the lake. Go with my friends... Oh!!! The relaxing that you can have, the fresh air that you can absorb🍀🍀🍀, the peaceful of people surround you that you can feel it yourself🌱🌱🌱 it like renewing your soul, releasing every last hard breath of your awful day. Every single day is a bad day, but it will my kick out of your heart, if you can enjoy day. My secret hiding and relying my soul ❤
Many Koreans live here, the scenery is good and beautiful

Saw a lot of people taking photos so I went to check out this attraction.  This bronze statue is of a former emperor, who founded what is now modern Hanoi.  

There were teens practising their skateboarding skills while some mature ladies congregated near the statue and seemed to enjoy chatting among themselves.   

A nice park to visit.

Definitely worth a look, although there is a dilema with this place.
In order to take good photo, you need to be here on around noon (1pm-2pm) to have the best lighting condition.
But the place would be most crowded and "lively" on the afternoon (4:30pm - 5pm), when many young people come to play, practice young and wild activities, such as break dancing, skate boarding. They are really good at it, too.

Really nice park. Hanoi definitely surprised me! Around this park are lot of landmarks you just have to see for your self. In the evening when the sun sets its breath taking with all the lights and music. Also a lot of street benders around the park.
Didn't spent much time. One needs to understand the history and being there will definitely worth while. This round I dont manage to find out about respectable him. Next time may be.

Interesting statue of an important figure in Vietnamese history, but if you’re looking for English language information you’ll be disappointed. Instead you’ll have to read up online. The monument itself is really well done with nice stonework; the paving and walls are adorned with interesting motifs and carvings. A decent number of trees surround the perimeter of the site.

A very beautiful temple and has a very beautiful location. You feel like you are on island when you visit there. You have to cross a bridge on the lake and then reach this temple which itself is very exciting. The lake and bridge really looks beautiful in the evening. Definitely go and checkout this temple.

Nice place for a short walk. They have great bonsai trees. The temple is interesting because of its legend and location. The red bridge looks great at night. Although it's a very small place you have to pay an entry fee.

Really nice park. Hanoi definitely surprised me! Around this park are lot of landmarks you just have to see for your self. In the evening when the sun sets its breath taking with all the lights and music. Also a lot of street benders around the park.
Nice place but wife had her purse stolen from her bag so a downer was put on our visit. I'm sure staff would know if same person was going in day after day. Be careful when visiting this place

The temple is beautiful and has a great history. It worships one of the most important heroes in Vietnamese's  history. It is located in the center of Hanoi. It quiet and has a wonderful scenery. The price is 1.5$ per adult ticket and free for children under 15
Historically significant. Worth the trip to visit. Fantastic walking through the tiny side streets to get there and get a feel for the real life.

Historically interesting monument of a troubled time.  Lake is in a nice area and well maintained.  Not particularly picturesque but very interesting.  Looks as if the monument has been recently renovated compared to previous photos.
Place B52 landing
di tích lịh sử cấp Quốc gia
Điểm di tích sống , nơi mà du khách đc nhìn tần mắt chiếc máy bay rơi dưới hồ !

Saddening, not a place to take young or sensitive children, but highly educational. One section is dedicated to proving that American prisoners were very well treated. The little gift shop has cute little items that are really reasonably priced. Fixed prices.

Its a very good place to come and learn about the history of vietnam. Prisoners of war and how it was like being in the prison back then. The place is very well preserved and constructed for tourist and all to experience the place back then. Highly recommend that you get a guide!

Vietnam's version of events that took place here contrast greatly with documented testimony of prisoners that were housed here.  There were pictures of the POWs playing basketball and board games as well as writing letters home often and receiving items from home that they needed.  I recommend visiting this historic site but be ready to read the Vietnamese propaganda.  The people from Hanoi were very friendly and welcoming.

In almost ten years traveling South East Asia and I  had a bit of an education here at Hoa Lo. Caught a woman picking my wallet out of a low pocket in my cargo shorts. 

We were in the room with the guillotine. Felt a slight touch and looked down to see my wallet hanging over the side. I caught a big break! 

Went to security. We watched her try it on instant replay. Asian woman working with a guy. As soon as I stopped her she went up to the guillotine and pretended to pose for a picture by the man! it took me a second to figure out what went down. I didn’t even see what she did next until the replay. She was also posing for the security camera! When I left they were doing a search. Be careful!

This is one of the must visit sites in Hanoi if you want to begin to get an idea of Vietnam's colonial past and more recent history. The other essential site is the Women's Museum which is also packed with historical information.

The museum is only a very small part of the original prison as most has been redeveloped as a commercial high rise property, but there is more than enough remaining to give you a very clear idea of just how horrific this place was. Originally built by French colonial powers, this prison was one of many across Vietnam used to imprison and torture Vietnamese independence fighters. Many were executed and the guillotine is one of the grim exhibits here.

There is plenty of display material to document many of the freedom fighters executed here but it is the barbaric and inhumane living conditions which also makes a powerful impact. People were thrown in here, shackled, and to be forgotten or got rid of. It's brutal.

The more modern use of the prison during the Vietnam War is also very interesting. Obviously there is a lot more photographic evidence etc and more exhibits. As a Westerner it is interesting to experience reading about the war from an opposing view to the one we are usually given at home. There is plenty of propaganda woven in to the choice of exhibits and how they are presented, but then history is written by the winners as they say.
Food was decent and the prices were very reasonable. There's plenty of choices from one end of the street to the next end. A must visit when you come to Chumphon.
So fun ! Got the deepfried bread with coconut frosting
Night market not big but definetelly worth visiting
Small nigh street shopping.
Nice attraction for tourist that visit Chumphon. The mango rice and the thai pastry shop next to it is a must try and you can find all sorts of delicious desserts along the night bazaar.

My newly met friend found this place thanks to Google recomendations of others, after we "fed up" with one place to eat good food. 
And I liked Bun Cha Ta! 
Perfect spring rolls. They were very yummy! !! Served with soup, noodles and herbs. Waitress will explain how to mix this and eat properly.  I enjoyed it there. 
Also tried egg coffee in this place.  Was good.

Absolutely delicious local Hanoi food. 
From the moment you enter, the staff immediately makes you feel welcome and appreciated. 
When your food arrives, they proceed to explain the correct way to eat Bun Cha( grilled pork in a broth served with noodles), which means dumping as much herbs, seasonings and spices as you please in the broth, and slowly dip the noodles in the mix. 
Apart from their eponymous dish, Bun Cha Ta also serves delicious spring rolls, which will offer a nice change of taste as an appetizer or side dish.
Finally, this place is very affordable and cozy, perfect for couples, friends and families.

First time having Bun Cha and love it! Flavoursome and nutritious, it filled me up for the rest of the day.
Went for the ‘recommended’ $100k option and it was perfect. 
Definitely a tourist place though. If you like street food with small stools by the street, this isn’t for you.

Kinda touristy, no locals there when I was there for dinner. If you are looking for less "vietnamese local", this might be good choice.  Server was sweet and spoke great English.  Good Bun Cha but went to a different one my first day which was better and more authentic.  Would recommend!

Ugh SO GOOD. Been thinking about this meal since I had it. Crab spring rolls are perfect,
Good strong crab flavor. Bun cha broth and patties are delicious, and most importantly you can control your spice level with the chili sauce on the tables. One of the best meals I’ve had so far in Vietnam.
Lovely food. Like!
Cơm chay giá rẻ, đồ chay phong phú và ăn cũng rất ngon nữa
Quán cơm chay giá rẻ, có món Phở chay, bánh giò chay nổi tiếng, còn các món khác ăn cũng tàm tạm thôi ạ. Quán hơi nhỏ và bí nên khi nào muốn đổi vị em sẽ quay lại.

Amazing food!!! The deep friend spring rolls were very flavourful and crispy. The veggies are very good and there is a lot of variety. The meat and the soup were very tasty. 100% recommend. Fyi it's a very busy place.

Super delicious! Best meal in Hanoi. We ordered the Combo 1 and it came with a lot of veggies, grilled meat dipped in sweet savory sauce and the rice vermicelli. The staff was really friendly as well to teach us how to eat it.
First bun cha we had! Delicious savory broth, light on tang and funkiness. Fresh herbs and greens, meat had nice grilled flavor and good chew.  Really tasty spring rolls with nice crab flavor.

Vietnamese food, even if a little basic, offers a world of surprises that brings one back to the elemental roots of  Asian cuisine. Bun Cha, or grilled pork served over soup, vegetables and rice noodles, represents Vietnam at its authentic best, and nowhere else other than Bun Cha Dac Kim at the core of Old Hanoi serves it as deliciously and delightfully. Not to be missed!
Delicious food. Big serving good for two. Stair is quite steep. Dangerous going up to 3rd floor

Never in life i see so many people eating ice cream at the same time at night. They have been doing ice cream since 1958. However, it taste similar to Klebang Coconut Milk Shake. About RM2 for one. They provide parking space for park and eat. Kinda cool. Located near the old quarters lake.
Ice cream was nice and very milky. Makes for an excellent dessert after a big dinner.
A good place to buy traditional Hanoi ice cream, must try it if you visit Hanoi 😊

It's pretty funny because it's not much to look at now but this is the most famous ice-cream place in all of Hanoi. It is a great place to go and make a stop on the way to the opera House. Also their "cớm" or rice icecream is pretty darn fantastic, even if it sounds weird.
The mochi of the strawberry is the best , next will be green tea . For the come ice cream , the rice cake corn(the first ice cream) on the menu is a must try . Different ice cream and it's cheap
Spicy cheesy chicken for 85K sizzling hot and tasted good. Flat white coffee 65K is fantastic. Everything about this place is perfect but expensive.
Nice cafe'
Nice but expensive
서머셋 그랜드 하노이에 투숙하면서 마켓들렸다 호기심에 가보았다.식사하기에 좋은곳이며 흡연석이 있다.피자.파스타.쌀국수.커피등 다양한 메뉴가 있어서 장점이다.
Quán Cafe Papa Joe's, Tầng 1, Ha Noi Tower, 49, Hai Bà Trưng, Quận Hoàn Kiếm, Hàng Bông, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội, Việt Nam
Went here for breakfast with wifey. It's so tasty. Not too salty, quick service and it's easy to find. If you're in Hanoi's OQ and looking for phở bò, come here. 55K (VND) a bowl.
Great little hole in the wall spot!
Good food. Closed after 11am
Out of the 4+ * rated Phô places I tried in Hanoi, this was by far the best one. Strong broth and tender meat. With 60.000 VND pricier , but worth it.
Very good dishes,  a little expensive

We were thrilled to find this restaurant and had a great lunch. Great outdoor seating. 

Rice pancake dish is a “thing” here and very well worth the experience. 

We found the service to be friendly and though sitting outside was a bit hot, we really enjoyed the experience.

A great place to eat local food of quality. The food is not expensive and the service is great. The waitress told me which dishes were gluten free so I didn't get sick. And I even had a dessert! Highly recommend if you visit Hanoi. I had Pho soup and some black beans soup dessert which were great!

It was great. So much choice didn't know where to start. Service was efficient. Food was excellent. Not a single dish was below Standard. Fantastic. Great value for money. Extremely tasty and satisfying!

Not a good place to look for authentic Vietnamese food. I came to dine with my parents and my niece. We ordered 2 pancakes, 8 fresh spring rolls (2 shrimp+pork & 6 pickled pig ear), 1 bowl of steamed snails, a sour beef salad and 2 bowls of chicken soup. The dipping sauce was very disappointing. My family came from Central Vietnam and never in our lives did we put mung beans and onions in our pancakes. The saving grace was the soup (my niece loved it) but I attribute this to the fact that you can never go wrong with a chicken soup recipe here in Vietnam. The bill wasn't at all expensive but I considered it not worth the mediocre food.
Very very popular amongst tourists and locals alike. Despite being so busy the service was good and the food excellent. Would recommend this place. You may need to share a table at busy times.

Very cool view.  Unfortunately very average at best food.  Come here for people watching, appetizers and a cold drink.  Enough fans to keep the humidity down so sitting outside was just fine.  Maybe better locations but we enjoyed the experience.

This is an awesome place to sit, drink beer, and watch the street below. However, don’t eat here! You can tell from the very extensive menu that they couldn’t possibly do all those things well. It could be what we chose, but my son had the pork soup with vegetables. It came out as beef soup and vegetables, with ramen noodles. The meat was very chewy, and the main flavor was salt. I ordered the vegetarian curry - probably my mistake ordering curry at a Vietnamese restaurant, but it was objectively awful. Anyway, great place to sit and drink beer. To eat, get street food. They all specialize in one thing they do well...
I really enjoyed my beef pho! Inexpensive and highly recommended. Second floor seating overlooking the street below is nice (and popular!)

Great location in the old quarter to sit and watch everything going on beneath you as has a balcony overlooking a crossroad. A little bit more expensive that some but that is due to location. The beef pho was the best we had the whole week so would definitely recommend paying a tiny bit extra to eat here :)

It's a nice restaurant, mostly for tourists. Lots of food options at fair prices. The second floor balcony overlooks the street, which is fun. Staff speak English. Credit cards accepted with a 3% surcharge (which is very common)
Food is OK but pricey. Small place but cozy. They do not take credit card
Food is ok. Friendly staff
등갈비 작은거 시키거나 아예 안먹으면 바보임 바보도 그런 바보가 없음 글구 종업원에게 엠어이라 불르면 개 털림 나말고 S씨 털려벌
다른것도 괜찮은데 특히 새우커리 뭔가 얼큰하고 맛있다.
Rất tốt
Nice place to sit and spend some time. Don't let me talk about the cake! Sweet, delicious and reasonably priced. If you want to have a great cake experience far from home, you found the place.

Only good if you can stomach calves’ milk and eggs excreted from chickens. But too many “fancy” cakes and pastries here, although under the broad awning in front of the stylishly designed bakery/cafe there is plentiful seating. That’s a plus, the only one. Close to the Women’s Empowerment Museum, across the road. Go to the cultural institution, avoid this place if you care about your health and conscience.

They can bake!!!

I love the breads and cakes here!

I think this is the nest bakery in town. Considering the taste and price, yeah it is the best local bakery in Hanoi!

They also offer coffee and some drinks on the sidewalk, in front of the store so you can enjoy the Hanoi vibes

Ngon qua!

I've been here twice and going again today. Many varieties of pastries and good tea and coffee.  The pastries are is good as any I've had in Paris. It's fun to sit in the outdoor cafe and enjoy Hanoi streetlife with a pastry (or two) and coffee. 2 pastries and coffee about 85,000 dong.
Wait till the next colonial building of Trung Vuong school finished, you can have best place in Hanoi for both good cake/coffee/tea and Hanoi's most beautiful street.

The food was good, had to celebrate Christmas somehow. They only had this smoke room open and the waiter did nothing but cough. They are also allegedly a cigar salon so perhaps there's a red line here.
Cozy atmostphere with good beer. Great german food as well.
Good beer but not cheap
excellent food, beautifully cooked and a nice quiet corner
Great place to enjoy German beer and food in Hanoi. Good food.

The food is good and the environment is cosy with an European feel. The owner is an Italian and very friendly. The staff are friendly also but need more training. They didn't give us the complimentary bread basket until we asked. The location is very central. Worth trying.

The restaurant was cute and quaint and the manager friendly. Then got the food. The salad I ordered looked and tasted like lawn clippings. The replacement salad was bland and tasteless. My husbands lasagna although tasty was served lukewarm. Once you complain the manager is no longer friendly. I would not bother
Excellent food!!! Very kind waiters. They are very accomadating. The quality of the food is 5 stars. Their Pizza is very delicious. Please eat in this restaurant!! 👍🏼👍🏼

Very delicious Italian restaurant in the middle of Hanoi with fresh food and a lot of choices.
The place is well located and the workers are nice.
But for this kind of food, do not expect to have the same prices as you could have in a Vietnamese restaurant. The dishes are a little bit too pricey.

Very good Italian food no matter if you're in Hanoi or even Rome.  Servers are fine with speaking English. I actually left my credit card there by mistake (most potentially a nightmare); however,  I called the following day and they had it for me safe and sound.

I had a very good experience here. I expected to wait a long time to be served but they were super quick! The choice of food is amazing and everything is vegan, an oasis in this part of the city. Prices are higher but I am ok with that if taste and quality have this level. Definitely recommended!

More expensive then your usual restaurant here. Fancy menu. The watermelon juice was a bit warm. The waiter did not understand English. I asked for rice, the waiter nodded, but I got no rice so had to use Google translate the second time. The eggplant dish was small, but great taste. But a bit oily. 192k for a watermelon juice, eggplant dish and rice.
The enthusiasm of Mr G for veganism was wonderful to see. He is a very talented man a the menu was amazing and the food we ordered was devoured in no time. Great host, lovely place and top food.

Best vegan place in Hanoi; my wife is vegan, but I’m not and I came to Hanoi to eat... I never felt I was compromising at Minh Chay. The food is imaginative and well cooked and presented.

4 stars from a meat-eater is quite a compliment.

AVOID!! Spent most of time waiting for service. Waited 20 minutes to order food. Food greasy. Bland too. Starter. Hot dog. Oily. The chilli sauce is not a good match. Mock meat skewers. Bland. Oily. Tofu and green banana. Tasteless. Fried mushroom. Oily. Really very bad food, doesn’t promote vegetarianism in good way. Drinks served when meal almost finished. Flies everywhere. 500k, for that. Terrible. Worst customer service I’ve ever had.

My thin crust “beefy” pizza was pretty good and came at a good price! The beers are well priced and the service was friendly. Outdoor seating, but beware, the odors emanating from the street can be a bit overwhelming.
Amazing buffet. Shame its only 3 days a week. Great value for money
If you like a pizza it's a good place to eat a pizza. The favourite one is Bolognese pizza. 😍😍😍
Worst pizza ever. If you are looking for a "Vietnamese food break" and want to try an American style pizza like Domino's or Pizza Hut, do not waste your time and money here. Overpriced.
Most delicious place for Italian food, very good attitude, I really like decorations theme, good price and delicious portions

Great burritos from friendly staff in this small place with seating upstairs but you're going to need a big appetite to finish one of these meals.

All the usual Mexican style options are here including quesadillas and burritos, with vegetarian options.

Colourful and quirky decor and layout but a great feed.
Rude attendance, horrible songs..
Oh, Yes, Tamarind now changed to CUISINE VIET FOODS. Was amazing. We had great time to seat and enjoy the food.

We visited Tamarind Cafe (rated #145 out of 856 restaurants on TripAdvisor) which is next door to Tu Linh Palace Hotel 2.  Tamarind Cafe is a vegetarian restaurant with a relaxed couch atmosphere. We order spring rolls, both fresh and fried, the food tastes bland. I don't think this place is good value. We stayed for a while as the place has many plug sockets, good WiFi and relaxed atmosphere.
Not bad taste and service. Can not speak korean and english.
Fresh and kindly service... i like it...
Great coffé and service
Don's place is the best Restaurant I've been to. Great staff, the food was amazing.  I highly recommend there steaks and Osters. What a great place.
Celebrated our Thanksgiving here, good foods, live music with beautiful lake view on the top floor.
Delicious food, beautiful view. However, better go for dinner in summer because too much sunshine will make them cover glass windows, then no view
Not a huge restaurant but the 2nd and 3rd levels house attractive decor with a good view over the smaller part of the lake. A superb place for conversation and romantic dining purposes.

Below average food, in quality and taste. Slow service. And dear god this place is overpriced. Was my first time dining here and i had high hopes but the Valentines day menu was SO awful. I felt like i was eating at one those restaurants in Kitchen Nightmare. The experience ruined my valentines night, thanks Don's.

I would give Cal Mare 10 stars if that was possible! My friend and I went there for an event in October and enjoyed food at the bar with other friends and it was all so delicious. We then went back in February to celebrate our belated birthdays and wow, they just blew us away! We arrived to find a lovely birthday card for each of us on the table which was signed by the entire staff. They gave us a complimentary glass of champaign to start off the celebration. We ordered so much food and were just amazed at the beautiful presentations and incredible flavors!! Our waiter Nicholas was excellent and so attentive to us. The General Manager Robert came out to say hello and happy birthdays to us. I had met him during our first visit as well and he is always so sweet and kind. We saw friends at the bar who said they go often and raved of the wonderful, long happy hour. The restaurant is a magnificent addition to the newly remodeled Beverly Center. There's a new entrance where you just pull up to the valet in front of the restaurant. Prices are good, service is excellent, food is absolutely delicious and the restaurant is gorgeous - I highly recommend you go!
Love love love this restaurant. The food is delicious and service is incredible. I was shocked with the attention to detail. I hope to come back soon.

While the food is pretty good here, it was hard to justify the price.  it does have a good ambiance and the staff is great.. I've been to a fair share of high end restaurants and the portions here are even smaller per dollar than most places. it does have a good ambiance and the staff is great.

We tried both of the happy hour pizzas and had a couple of drinks. The pizzas were good and drinks were very solid for the happy hour price, but the service was the slowest it could get - it took 45 min to get our drinks! I did not see the lady at the bar (not sure if she was a bartender) ever making any drinks. Our drinks were finally made by the waiter, 45 min after we ordered them.
Apart from that the experience was nice - good vibe, chic decor, decent food and drinks.

Nice Ambiente, prices are okay. Wine is about 135.000 a glass, Pizza begins at 185.000 Dong for 28 cm. 
They only had 1 red wine and 2 white wines though. 
The pizza was good, but had far too much mozzarella on it to be called an Italian original. 
Service was good, but I'm not so much into staff watching me eat, a bit of discretion might be better.
Really good Italian restaurant in Hanoi. Probably the closest to Italian food I had so far in Vietnam, although it's still quite far :)

Spaghetti (with mushrooms) was really good. But the pizza was very bad. It looked like a pizza from Pizza Hut and was almost uniquely composed of a super thick layer of bad cheese. That's sad because a lot of dishes looked good.
This is the best Italian restaurant in Vietnam for sure! Staff speaks good English and the service is 5*. Food was delicious and they have a big wine list.
Excellent Italian dishes and wines for reasonable prices,at a nice location and friendly staff

Great venue for small, private events. Staff are professional and accommodating. Presentation of food looked appealing and but the taste was not as good. Drink selections for the event was limited, only still water, wine and carbonated juice were available.

Personally, I think the level of the restaurant was average for both food and service at the time of my visit. My wife and I came with a tour group. It was obvious that we are treated differently compared with other customers who made the reservations themselves. Although the staff were polite, the dishes were served without proper introductions. As for the food, it was not bad but below my expectation.

Elegant place. If you want to find a place to relax and taste some liquor, take a chance on this. Surprisingly, I came at Sat night, but only a few customers. The price is reasonable, for my long island is 175.000 vnd.
Nice place, nice food
Nice restaurant with good service but not so high European level. Price is affordable. I will recommend it
